segments.text: I can't help but feel bad for the state of this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's intent on drying that plate, apron tied neatly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet the sink behind her is a waterfall of trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Overflowing onto the floor, making everything slick.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are up to no good with the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Boy on that unstable stool, risking a fall for sweets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Girl aiding and abetting, hand raised high.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's all so unnecessary, this sneaky behavior.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water damages the wood, a slow ruin.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window's garden mocks the indoor disarray.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot in the puddleâ€”slippery danger awaits.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope it ends without tears or broken bones.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Stacked bowls nearby, innocent in the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What a way to turn a normal day upside down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open doors reveal more than just cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR
